intro: Vincetoxicum ventricosum, commonly known as the clustered snakeroot, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It is a member of the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its woody stems and clusters of small, tubular flowers. The plant produces yellow or orange flowers that bloom in late summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Vincetoxicum ventricosum is typically found in woodland areas and can thrive in partial to full shade.
